title: A Meta-Learning Approach for Robust Rank Learning
abstract: Learning eective feature-based ranking functions is a fundamental task for search engines, and has recently become an active area of research [10, 3, 2]. Many of these recent algorithms are based on the pairwise preference framework, in which instead of taking documents in isolation, document pairs are used as instances in the learning process. One disadvantage of this process is that a noisy relevance judgment on a single document can lead to a large number of mis-labeled document pairs. This can jeopardize robustness and deteriorate overall ranking performance. In this paper we study the eects of outlying pairs in rank learning with pairwise preferences and introduce a new meta-learning algorithm capable of suppressing these undesirable eects. This algorithm works as a second optimization step in which any linear baseline ranker can be used as input. Experiments on eight dierent ranking datasets show that this optimization step produces statistically significant performance gains over various state-of-the-art baseline rankers.
